body:
### Problem On the latest nightly version, diagnostics signs are not used when rendering the sign column. I checked my signs with `:signs list` Neovim version: ``` NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1873+g8f08b1efb Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1702233742 Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info ``` ### Steps to reproduce minimal_init.lua:
minimal_init.lua ```lua local function join_paths(...) local path_sep = '/' local result = table.concat({ ... }, path_sep) return result end local temp_dir = vim.loop.os_getenv 'TEMP' or '/tmp' local package_root = join_paths(temp_dir, 'nvim', 'site', 'lazy') local lazypath = join_paths(temp_dir, 'nvim', 'site') .. '/lazy/lazy.nvim' if not vim.loop.fs_stat(lazypath) then vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', '--filter=blob:none', '--single-branch', 'https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git', lazypath, } end vim.opt.runtimepath:prepend(lazypath) _G.load_config = function() vim.lsp.set_log_level 'trace' require('vim.lsp.log').set_format_func(vim.inspect) local nvim_lsp = require 'lspconfig' local on_attach = function(client, bufnr) print('On Attach ' .. client.name .. ' ' .. bufnr) end local signs = { Error = '', Warn = ' ', Hint = ' ', Info = ' ', } for type, icon in pairs(signs) do local hl = 'DiagnosticSign' .. type vim.fn.sign_define(hl, { text = icon, texthl = hl, numhl = hl }) end -- load treesitter require('nvim-treesitter.configs').setup { highlight = { enable = true }, } -- Add the server that troubles you here local name = 'tsserver' if not name then print 'You have not defined a server name, please edit minimal_init.lua' end if not nvim_lsp[name].document_config.default_config.cmd and not cmd then print [[You have not defined a server default cmd for a server that requires it please edit minimal_init.lua]] end nvim_lsp[name].setup { on_attach = on_attach, } print [[You can find your log at $HOME/.cache/nvim/lsp.log. Please paste in a github issue under a details tag as described in the issue template.]] end require('lazy').setup({ 'habamax/vim-habamax', 'neovim/nvim-lspconfig', 'nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter', config = function() local configs = require 'nvim-treesitter.configs' configs.setup { ensure_installed = 'all', highlight = { enable = true, additional_vim_regex_highlighting = false, }, } end, }, { root = package_root, }) _G.load_config() vim.cmd [[colorscheme habamax]] ```
create a simple javascript file and open it: ```bash cat < /tmp/foo.js const hello = 'world' EOF nvim --clean -u minimal_init.lua /tmp/foo.js ``` remove the `c` of `const` to create a diagnostic, notice the sign is E even though `DiagnosticSignError` sign is defined: ### Expected behavior diagnostic sign should be used ### Neovim version (nvim -v) NVIM v0.10.0-dev-1873+g8f08b1efb ### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same? can't reproduce, no lsp ### Operating system/version macOS 13.6 ### Terminal name/version iterm2 Build 3.5.0beta15 ### $TERM environment variable xterm-256color ### Installation asdf-vm

labels.description: issues that are closed as duplicates of other issues
labels.name: closed:duplicate

title: diagnostics signs on nightly
